data.text: @nsgov Not happy with the access to tests.  With the price of gas you can't afford to go to several locations.   It is a first come service so you might drive there and they have no more test kits.

@nsgov The state of emergency is what gives you the power to put healthcare workers on unpaid leave for not taking the shot that doesnt prevent spread, how are you able to keep them on unpaid leave after the state of emergency ends?

@nsgov Not happy at all with this new reporting system. Nova Scotians want to see statistics more clearly, and daily. After 2 years you’ve left us to flounder and guess at how we’re doing. On https://t.co/JSYMMBE5YW daily stats, NS and SK are the only 2 provinces not reporting.😡

@nsgov Terrible reporting as we have no 
 Idea what is happening in our province as information is useless. Where are the cases, ICU updates, current active cases, etc., the old format provided us with at least that info and now we have nothing except what happened over the last week.
@nsgov You know it’s a tough news year when you scroll COVID news for a break on reading other news.
@nsgov I wonder sometimes? It seems since the government scamdemic has been seen transparent suddenly all the numbers start going down.
@annwmac @nsgov As covid moves down the priority list, I think you can expect less time  put into it. It’s not really front page news anymore
